name.en: Introduction to programming skills for artificial intelligence

department.en: Department of Biomedical Sciences and Engineering

remark.ch: 醫學工程與資訊科學組

goal.en: The course focuses on guiding the DBSE students regarding the skills of python programming. We are going to discuss two key packages, NumPy and Pandas. Then we will also demonstrate the applications of machine learning or deep learning-related packages. In the end, we will briefly describe the main deep learning networks, such as CNN, RNN, GAN, and ResNet technologies and related implementations.
goal.ch: 本課程專注於教導生醫系學生python相關程式使用指引、NumPy與Pandas兩個重點套件以及機械學習或深度學習相關套件的認識與應用。並將簡述主要的深度學習網路，如CNN、RNN、GAN以及ResNet等技術以及相關實作。

content.en:
Week 01: Introduction
Week 02: Basic structures
Week 03: Flow control
Week 04: Functions and modules
Week 05: Introduction to pipelines
Week 06: Data I/O and Exception
Week 07: Class and object-oriented programming
Week 08: Packages
Week 09: Midterm exam
Week 10: Array and structure of NumPy
Week 11: Indexing and slicing
Week 12: Data structure of Pandas
Week 13: Important mechanisms for data interactions
Week 14: Introduction to CNN
Week 15: Introduction to RNN
Week 16: Introduction to GAN
Week 17: Introduction to ResNet
Week 18: Final exam
content.ch:
第 一 週：基礎認識
第 二 週：基本資料結構
第 三 週：流程控制
第 四 週：函數與模組
第 五 週：管線的認識
第 六 週：檔案讀寫與例外處理
第 七 週：類別與物件導向
第 八 週：套件
第 九 週：期中考
第 十 週：NumPy陣列與結構
第十一週：索引與切片
第十二週：Pandas的資料結構
第十三週：資料互動的重要機制
第十四週：CNN介紹
第十五週：RNN介紹
第十六週：GAN介紹
第十七週：ResNet介紹
第十八週：期末考

textbook.en: 1. Naomi Ceder, The Quick Python Book, Third Edition. 2. Sebastian Raschka, Python Machine Learning, 3rd Edition. 3. François Chollet, Deep Learning with Python.
textbook.ch: 1. Naomi Ceder, The Quick Python Book, Third Edition. 2. Sebastian Raschka, Python Machine Learning, 3rd Edition. 3. François Chollet, Deep Learning with Python.

grading.en: Participation 10%, Assignments 20%, midterm exam 30%, and final exam 40%.
grading.ch: 課程參與10%、作業20%、期中考30%、期末考40%

domain.en: 計算分析領域 、 醫學電子資訊與影像處理
domain.ch: 計算分析領域 、 醫學電子資訊與影像處理

en.competency: Learn the basics of mathematics, physics, chemistry, medicine, biology and their applications in healthcare
Ability to perform experimental design, data analysis and inference
Familiar with clinical medicine, and cultivate the ability of design, development, and field applications of biomedical devices or materials
Familiar with the principles of sensing elements, learn the ability to design, manufacture and integrate intelligent systems
The ability to discover, explore, analyze, process and reconstruct problems
Cultivate the ability of integrating multi-level cross-domain teamwork
Understand the reconciliation between professional knowledge and humanistic ethics, as well as the impact of technology on the environment and society, and the ability to continuous learning
